Ti.Proxy.description: The base for all Titanium objects.

Ti.Module.description: Base type for all Titanium modules.

Ti.UI.View.description: An empty drawing surface or container

Global.description: The APIs that reside in the global scope, which may be called without a namespace prefix.

Intl.Collator.description: Immutable object used to perform language sensitive string comparisons.

CollatorOptions.description: Options to be passed into the Global.Intl.Collator.constructor method.

Intl.DateTimeFormat.description: Immutable object used to generate localized date and time formatted strings.

DateTimeFormatOptions.description: Options to be passed into the Global.Intl.DateTimeFormat.constructor method.

DateTimeFormattedPart.description: Generic type for elements of returned Array from <Intl.DateTimeFormat.formatToParts>

Intl.description: Namespace providing JavaScript's standard internationalization APIs.

Intl.NumberFormat.description: Immutable object used to convert numbers to localized numeric strings.

NumberFormatOptions.description: Options to be passed into the Global.Intl.NumberFormat.constructor method.

NumberFormattedPart.description: Generic type for elements of returned Array from <Intl.Number.formatToParts>

assert.description: A Node.js-compatible implementation of the core assert module

assert.strict.description: An extension of assert which overrides some of the methods to use their strict counterparts.

assert.AssertionError.description: Indicates the failure of an assertion. All errors thrown by the assert module will be instances of the AssertionError class.

assert.AssertionError.options.description: options used in the assert.AssertionError constructor argument

buffer.description: A Node.js-compatible implementation of the core buffer module

buffer.Buffer.description: The Buffer class is a global type for dealing with binary data directly. It can be constructed in a variety of ways.

events.description: A Node.js-compatible implementation of the core events module

EventEmitter.description:
The EventEmitter class is defined and exposed by the events module: 
const EventEmitter = require('events');
All EventEmitters emit the event 'newListener' when new listeners are added and 'removeListener' when existing listeners are removed.

fs.description: A Node.js-compatible implementation of the core fs module

fs.constants.description: commonly used constants for file system operations

fs.Stats.description: A fs.Stats object provides information about a file.

fs.Dirent.description: A representation of a directory entry, which can be a file or a subdirectory within the directory, as returned by reading from an <fs.Dir>. The directory entry is a combination of the file name and file type pairs. NOTE: Titanium does not currently implement this type.

fs.mkdir.options.description: options for fs.mkdir and fs.mkdirSync methods

fs.mkdtemp.options.description: options for fs.mkdtemp and fs.mkdtempSync methods

fs.readdir.options.description: options for fs.readdir and fs.readdirSync methods

fs.stat.options.description: options for fs.fstat, fs.fstatSync, fs.lstat, fs.lstatSync, fs.stat, and fs.statSync methods

fs.WriteStream.description: Instances of fs.WriteStream are created and returned using the fs.createWriteStream() function. NOTE: Titanium defines an empty class for this type. No methods/properties are implemented!

fs.ReadStream.description: Instances of fs.ReadStream are created and returned using the fs.createReadStream() function. NOTE: Titanium defines an empty class for this type. No methods/properties are implemented!

os.description: A Node.js-compatible implementation of the core os module

CPUInfo.description: Abstract type defined for the return value os.cpus().

CPUInfoTimes.description: Abstract type defined for the return value of os.cpus().

EncodingOptions.description: Abstract type defined for os.userInfo(). NOTE that these options are currently ignored by Titanium!

path.description: A Node.js-compatible implementation of the core path module

PathObject.description: Abstract type defined for path.format and path.parse

process.description: A Node.js-compatible implementation of the core process module

EmitWarningOptions.description: An abstract type for the options that may be passed to process.emitWarning().

string_decoder.description: A Node.js-compatible implementation of the core string_decoder module

StringDecoder.description: The primary class exported by the string_decoder core module.

util.description: A Node.js-compatible implementation of the core util module

UtilInspectOptions.description: Abstract type for the options object passed to util.inspect

util.types.description: util.types provides type checks for different kinds of built-in objects. Unlike instanceof or Object.prototype.toString.call(value), these checks do not inspect properties of the object that are accessible from JavaScript (like their prototype), and usually have the overhead of calling into C++. The result generally does not make any guarantees about what kinds of properties or behavior a value exposes in JavaScript. They are primarily useful for addon developers who prefer to do type checking in JavaScript.

Ti.API.description: The top-level API module, containing methods to output messages to the system log.

Ti.Accelerometer.description: The top-level Accelerometer module, used to determine the device's physical position.

Ti.Android.ActionBar.description:
An action bar is a window feature that identifies the application and user location,
and provides user actions and navigation modes.

Ti.Android.Activity.description: The Titanium binding of an Android Activity.

ActivityResult.description: Simple object passed to the startActivityForResult callback.

ActivityLifecycleCallbackObject.description: Simple object passed to the Titanium.Android.Activity callbacks for onCreate, onDestroy, onPause, onResume, onStart, onStop, onRestart. Additional properties may be set on the Object.

OptionsMenuCallbackObject.description: Simple object passed to the Titanium.Android.Activity callbacks for onPrepareOptionsMenu and onCreateOptionsMenu. Additional properties may be set on the Object.

RequestPermissionAccessResult.description: Argument passed to the callback when a request finishes successfully or erroneously.

Ti.Android.BigPictureStyle.description: Helper object for generating large-format notifications that include a large image attachment.

Ti.Android.BigTextStyle.description: Helper object for generating large-format notifications that include a lot of text.

Ti.Android.BroadcastReceiver.description: Monitor and handle Android system broadcasts.

Ti.Android.Intent.description: Message objects passed between Android application components.

Ti.Android.Menu.description: The Titanium binding of an Android Options Menu.

Ti.Android.MenuItem.description: The Titanium binding of an Android menu item.

Ti.Android.Notification.description: UI notifications that can be sent while the application is in the background.

Ti.Android.PendingIntent.description: The Titanium binding of an Android PendingIntent.

Ti.Android.QuickSettingsService.description: Android service for creating custom quick settings tiles and handling user's interaction with them.

showParams.description: Dictionary of options for the Titanium.UI.OptionDialog.show method.

Ti.Android.R.description: The Titanium binding of the native Android R class, giving access to Android system-wide resources or application resources.

Ti.Android.Service.description: Android application component that executes in the background.

Ti.App.Android.description: A module used to access Android application resources.

Ti.App.description:
The top-level App module is mainly used for accessing information about the
application at runtime, and for sending or listening for system events.

launchOptions.description: Dictionary describing the arguments passed to the application on startup. Use the getArguments method to retrieve the launch options.

Ti.App.Properties.description:
The App Properties module is used for storing application-related data in property/value pairs
that persist beyond application sessions and device power cycles.

Ti.App.iOS.BackgroundService.description: A service that runs when the application is placed in the background.

Ti.App.iOS.LocalNotification.description: A local notification to alert the user of new or pending application information.

Ti.App.iOS.SearchQuery.description:
A search query object manages the criteria to apply when searching app content that you have previously
indexed by using the Core Spotlight APIs.

Ti.App.iOS.SearchableIndex.description: The SearchableIndex module is used to add or remove Ti.App.iOS.SearchableItem objects from the device search index.

Ti.App.iOS.SearchableItem.description: Used to create a unique object containing all of the search information that will appear in the device search index.

Ti.App.iOS.SearchableItemAttributeSet.description: The SearchableItemAttributeSet module defines metadata properties for SearchItem and UserActivity objects.

Ti.App.iOS.UserActivity.description: The UserActivity module is used to enable device Handoff and to create User Activities.

Ti.App.iOS.UserDefaults.description:
The UserDefaults module is used for storing application-related data in property/value pairs
that persist beyond application sessions and device power cycles. UserDefaults allows the suiteName
of the UserDefaults to be specified at creation time.

Ti.App.iOS.UserNotificationAction.description: An action the user selects in response to an interactive notification.

Ti.App.iOS.UserNotificationCategory.description: A set of notification actions to associate with a notification.

Ti.App.iOS.UserNotificationCenter.description:
The top-level App iOS Notification Center module. It is used to control scheduled notifications
and receive details about the system-wide notification settings.

UserNotificationCallbackResponse.description: Response when receiving pending or local notifications in Titanium.App.iOS.UserNotificationCenter.getPendingNotifications and Titanium.App.iOS.UserNotificationCenter.getDeliveredNotifications.

UserNotificationDictionary.description: Dictionary of notification data used in the array of notifications when receiving pending or local notifications in Titanium.App.iOS.UserNotificationCenter.getPendingNotifications and Titanium.App.iOS.UserNotificationCenter.getDeliveredNotifications.

GetUserNotificationSettings.description: Dictionary object of parameters used to register the application with local notifications using the Titanium.App.iOS.registerUserNotificationSettings method.

Ti.App.iOS.description:
The top-level App iOS module, available only to iOS devices, that includes the facilities to
create and manage local notifications and background services.

NotificationParams.description: Dictionary object of parameters used to create a notification using Titanium.App.iOS.scheduleLocalNotification.

UserNotificationAttachment.description: Provide at least the property identifier and url property to identify a local image, sound or video. If your media is invalid, the API will throw an error log and skip the invalid attachment.

LaunchOptionsType.description:
Dictionary object of parameters used to identify an incoming URL that is handled
by the application.

UserNotificationSettings.description: Dictionary object of parameters used to register the application with local notifications using the Titanium.App.iOS.registerUserNotificationSettings method. To retrieve the current notification settings, use the Titanium.App.iOS.UserNotificationCenter.requestUserNotificationSettings method.

Ti.BlobStream.description: Wrapper around Titanium.Blob that implements the Titanium.IOStream interface.

Ti.Buffer.description: Buffer is a mutable, resizable container for raw data.

Ti.BufferStream.description: Wrapper around Titanium.Buffer that implements the Titanium.IOStream interface.

Ti.Calendar.Alert.description: An object that represents a single alert for an event in an calendar.

Ti.Calendar.Attendee.description: An object that represents a single attendee of an event.

Ti.Calendar.description: The Calendar module provides an API for accessing the native calendar functionality.

EventsAuthorizationResponse.description: Argument passed to the callback when a request finishes successfully or erroneously.

Ti.Calendar.Calendar.description: An object that represents a single calendar.

Ti.Calendar.Event.description: An object that represents a single event in a calendar.

Ti.Calendar.RecurrenceRule.description: An object that is used to describe the recurrence pattern for a recurring event.

Ti.Calendar.Reminder.description: An object that represents a single reminder for an event in a calendar.

Ti.Codec.description: A module for translating between primitive types and raw byte streams.

Ti.Contacts.description: The top-level Contacts module, used for accessing and modifying the system contacts address book.

showContactsParams.description: Dictionary of options for the Titanium.Contacts.showContacts method.

ContactsAuthorizationResponse.description: Argument passed to the callback when a request finishes successfully or erroneously.

Ti.Contacts.Group.description: An object which represents a group in the system contacts address book.

Ti.Contacts.Person.description:
An object that represents a contact record for a person or organization in the system contacts
address book.

BatchQueryError.description: Simple Error instance thrown from the executeAll method in case of failure

PossibleBatchQueryError.description: Simple Error argument provided to the callback from the executeAllAsync method in case of failure

Ti.Database.description: The top-level Database module, used for creating and accessing the in-application SQLite database.

ErrorResponse.description: Properties used in any event or callback which needs to report a success or failure.

SuccessResponse.description: Properties used in any event or callback which needs to report a success.

FailureResponse.description: Properties used in any event or callback which needs to report a failure.

Ti.Event.description: The base type for all Titanium events.

Ti.Filesystem.File.description: Object representing a path to a file or directory in the device's persistent storage.

Ti.Filesystem.FileStream.description: Wrapper around Titanium.Filesystem.File that implements the Titanium.IOStream interface

Ti.Filesystem.description: The top level filesystem module, used to access files and directories on the device.

RequestStorageAccessResult.description: Argument passed to the callback when a request finishes successfully or erroneously.

Ti.Geolocation.Android.LocationProvider.description: Represents a source of location information, such as GPS.

Ti.Geolocation.Android.LocationRule.description: A location rule to filter the results returned by location providers.

Ti.Geolocation.description: The top level Geolocation module. The Geolocation module is used for accessing device location based information.

LocationCoordinates.description: Simple object holding the data for a location update.

LocationCoordinatesFloor.description: Simple object holding floor of the building on which the user is located.

ForwardGeocodeResponse.description: Simple object returned in the callback from the forwardGeocoder method. Note that Android includes a number of extra fields.

HeadingData.description: Simple object holding compass heading data.

LocationProviderDict.description: Simple object describing a location provider.

ReverseGeocodeResponse.description: Simple object returned in the callback from the reverseGeocoder method.

GeocodedAddress.description: Simple object representing a place, returned in the callback from the reverseGeocoder method.

LocationAuthorizationResponse.description: Argument passed to the callback when a request finishes successfully or erroneously.

LocationAccuracyAuthorizationResponse.description: Argument passed to the callback when a request finishes successfully or erroneously.

Ti.Gesture.description:
The Gesture module is responsible for high-level device gestures such as orientation changes
and shake gestures.

Ti.IOStream.description: IOStream is the interface that all stream types implement.

MediaScannerResponse.description: Simple object passed to the scanMediaFiles callback.

Ti.Media.AudioPlayer.description: An audio player object used for streaming audio to the device, and low-level control of the audio playback.

TiMetadataItemType.description: An abstract type to represent a metadata item inside the metadata event (iOS only).

Ti.Media.AudioRecorder.description: An audio recorder object used for recording audio from the device microphone.

Ti.Media.Item.description: A representation of a media item returned by openMusicLibrary or queryMusicLibrary.

MusicLibraryOptionsType.description: Simple object for specifying options to openMusicLibrary.

MusicLibraryResponseType.description: Simple object passed to the openMusicLibrary success callback function.

MediaQueryType.description: A specifier for a media library query. By default, filters perform an exact match.

MediaQueryInfoType.description: A full query descriptor for a filtering predicate.

CameraOptionsType.description: Simple object for specifying options to showCamera.

PhotoGalleryOptionsType.description: Simple object for specifying options to openPhotoGallery.

CameraMediaMultipleItemsType.description: A media object from photo gallery when <Titanium.Media.allowMultiple> is true.

CameraMediaItemType.description: A media object from the camera or photo gallery.

PreviewImageError.description: The parameter passed to the error callback of PreviewImageOptions.

ScreenshotResult.description: The parameter passed to the Titanium.Media.takeScreenshot callback.

MediaAuthorizationResponse.description: Argument passed to the callback when a request finishes successfully or erroneously.

RequestCameraAccessResult.description: Argument passed to the callback when a request finishes successfully or erroneously.

RequestMusicLibraryAccessResult.description: Argument passed to the callback when a request finishes successfully or erroneously.

RequestPhotoGalleryAccessResult.description: Argument passed to the callback when a request finishes successfully or erroneously.

RouteDescription.description: An Object describing the current audio route.

Ti.Media.MusicPlayer.description: This object represents a music controller.

Ti.Media.Sound.description: An object for playing basic audio resources.

Ti.Media.VideoPlayer.description: A native control for playing videos.

ThumbnailResponse.description: Simple object passed to the thumbnail callback in response to the requestThumbnailImagesAtTimes method.

MovieSize.description: Simple object used to describe the size of a movie.

Ti.Network.BonjourBrowser.description: A browser for the discovery and retrieval of Bonjour services available on the network.

Ti.Network.BonjourService.description: Describes a service on the network which is published by Bonjour.

Ti.Network.Cookie.description: Cookie object used to manage the system cookie store and HTTP client cookie store.

Ti.Network.HTTPClient.description: HTTP client object that (mostly) implements the XMLHttpRequest specification.

SecurityManagerProtocol.description: The protocol that the Titanium.Network.HTTPClient.securityManager must implement.

APSConnectionDelegate.description: An extension of the NSURLConnectionDelegate protocol to allow users to participate in authentication and resource management for this HTTPClient.

ReadyStatePayload.description: An Object describing the current ready state. See onreadystatechange for more information.

PushNotificationConfig.description: Simple object for specifying push notification options to registerForPushNotifications.

PushNotificationSuccessArg.description: A simple object passed to the registerForPushNotifications success callback.

PushNotificationErrorArg.description: A simple object passed to the registerForPushNotifications error callback.

PushNotificationData.description: A simple object representing a push notification.

Ti.Network.Socket.description: Socket module, used for creating sockets.

Ti.Network.Socket.TCP.description: TCP socket that implements the Titanium.IOStream interface.

ConnectedCallbackArgs.description: Argument object passed to the connected callback when the socket connects.

ErrorCallbackArgs.description: Object passed to the error callback when the socket enters the ERROR state.

AcceptedCallbackArgs.description: Argument object passed to the accepted callback when a listener accepts a connection.

Ti.Platform.Android.description: The Android-specific Platform module, used to access the device's platform-related functionality.

Ti.Platform.DisplayCaps.description: The Display Caps object returned by the Titanium.Platform.displayCaps property.

Ti.Platform.description:
The top-level Platform module.  The Platform module is used to access the device's platform-related
functionality.

CPU.description: Simple object holding the data for a logical cpu.

CPUTimes.description: Simple object holding the data for a logical cpu execution times.

OpenURLOptions.description: The optional options to pass to the URL handling (iOS 10+). Pass a dictionary with one or more of the following string-keys: * UIApplicationOpenURLOptionsSourceApplicationKey (String value) * UIApplicationOpenURLOptionsAnnotationKey (Array value) * UIApplicationOpenURLOptionsOpenInPlaceKey (Boolean value) * UIApplicationOpenURLOptionUniversalLinksOnly (Boolean value) Read more about the available keys in the Apple documentation.

Ti.Stream.description: Stream module containing stream utility methods.

ReadCallbackArgs.description: Argument passed to the read callback when an asynchronous read operation finishes.

WriteCallbackArgs.description: Argument passed to the write callback when an asynchronous write operation finishes.

WriteStreamCallbackArgs.description: Argument passed to the callback when an asynchronous writeStream operation finishes.

PumpCallbackArgs.description: Argument passed to the callback each time the pump operation has new data to deliver.

CreateBufferArgs.description: Arguments to be passed to createBuffer

MatrixCreationDict.description: Simple object passed to Titanium.UI.create2DMatrix to initialize a matrix.

Ti.UI.ActivityIndicator.description: An activity indicator that lets the user know an action is taking place.

Ti.UI.ActivityIndicatorStyle.description: A set of constants for the styles available for Titanium.UI.ActivityIndicator objects.

Ti.UI.AlertDialog.description:
An alert dialog is a modal view that includes an optional title, a message and buttons,
positioned in the middle of the display.

Ti.UI.Android.description:
The Android-specific UI capabilities. All properties, methods and events in this namespace will only work on Android systems.

Drawer Layout

The drawer-layout components acts as a top-level container for window content that allows for interactive "drawer" views to be pulled out from one or both vertical edges of the window. It is represented by a centerView and optional leftView and rightView components that can be swiped in and out with additional configuration and transitions. Learn more about drawer-layouts in it's dedicated Titanium.UI.Android.DrawerLayout docs.

Ti.UI.Android.CardView.description: CardView provides a layout container with rounded corners and a shadow indicating the view is elevated.

Ti.UI.Android.DrawerLayout.description: A panel that displays the app's main navigation options on the left edge of the screen.

Ti.UI.Android.ProgressIndicator.description: A progress dialog or a horizontal progress bar in the title of the window.

Ti.UI.Android.SearchView.description: A specialized text field for entering search text.

AnimatedOptions.description: A JavaScript object holding an animated property. Used for many UI methods as a means of specifying some transition should be animated.

AnimatedWithDurationOptions.description: A JavaScript object holding animated and duration properties. Used on iOS For TablewView and ListView content offset transitions.

Ti.UI.Animation.description: The Animation object defines an animation that can be applied to a view.

Attribute.description: An abstract datatype for specifying an attributed string attribute.

ParagraphAttribute.description: An abstract datatype for specifying an Paragraph style attribute.

Ti.UI.AttributedString.description:
An attributed string proxy manages character strings and associated sets of attributes (for example,
font and foregroundcolor) that apply to individual characters or ranges of characters in the string.

Ti.UI.Button.description: A button widget that has four states: normal, disabled, focused and selected.

Ti.UI.Clipboard.description: A module used for accessing clipboard data.

Ti.UI.Color.description: Represents a color used for UI components.

Ti.UI.DashboardItem.description: A dashboard item is a view that is displayed as an icon in a Titanium.UI.DashboardView.

Ti.UI.DashboardView.description: A dashboard view is an iOS Springboard-like view of Titanium.UI.DashboardItem items that may be deleted and reordered by the user using its built-in edit mode.

Dimension.description: A simple object consisting of the position and size measurements. Effectively combines Size and Point but ensures numeric x/y values.

DimensionWithAbsolutes.description: An extension of Dimension where Android returns additional absolute X/Y values/properties for Titanium.UI.View.rect

Ti.UI.EmailDialog.description: An email dialog is a modal window that allows users to compose and send an email.

Font.description: An abstract datatype for specifying a text font.

Ti.UI.ImageView.description: A view to display a single image or series of animated images.

Ti.UI.Label.description: A text label, with an optional background image.

Ti.UI.ListItem.description: A list item is an individual item in a list section.

ItemTemplate.description: Template that represents the basic appearance of a list item.

ViewTemplate.description: Template that represents a view subcomponent of an ItemTemplate.

RowActionType.description: Represents the custom edit action for a ListItem.

Ti.UI.ListSection.description: A list section is a container within a list view used to organize list items.

Ti.UI.ListView.description:
A list view is used to present information, organized in to sections and items,
in a vertically-scrolling view.

ListViewAnimationProperties.description:
A simple object for specifying the animation properties to use when inserting or deleting
sections or cells, or scrolling the list.

ListViewIndexEntry.description: A simple object that represents an index entry in a ListView.

ListItemEventType.description: The arguments for the Titanium.UI.ListView.prefetch and Titanium.UI.ListView.cancelprefetch events.

Ti.UI.MaskedImage.description: A control that displays an image composited with a background image or color.

Ti.UI.Matrix2D.description: The 2D Matrix is an object for holding values for an affine transformation matrix.

Matrix2DCreationDict.description: Simple object passed to Titanium.UI.createMatrix2D to initialize a matrix.

Ti.UI.Matrix3D.description: The 3D Matrix is an object for holding values for a 3D affine transform.

Matrix3DCreationDict.description: Simple object passed to Titanium.UI.createMatrix3D to initialize a matrix.

Ti.UI.NavigationWindow.description: A NavigationWindow implements a specialized view that manages the navigation of hierarchical content.

Ti.UI.OptionBar.description: A bar of selectable buttons where only 1 can be selected at a time.

Ti.UI.OptionDialog.description:
An option dialog is a modal view that includes a message and one or more option items positioned
in the middle of the display on Android and at the bottom edge on iOS. On Android, buttons may
be added below the options.

hideParams.description: Dictionary of options for the Titanium.UI.OptionDialog.hide method.

HorizontalInsets.description: Dictionary object of parameters for horizontal-only insets applied to Table and List views. Only left and right properties are used (see Padding).

Padding.description: Dictionary object of parameters for the padding/insets applied to all kinds of views.

Ti.UI.Picker.description: A control used to select one or more fixed values.

Ti.UI.PickerColumn.description: A picker column, representing a selectable group of items in a Titanium.UI.Picker.

Ti.UI.PickerRow.description: A picker row, representing a selectable item in a Titanium.UI.Picker.

Ti.UI.RefreshControl.description: The RefreshControl is a representation of the native iOS UIRefreshControl and Android SwipeRefreshLayout.

Ti.UI.ScrollView.description: A view that contains a horizontally and/or vertically-scrollable region of content.

Ti.UI.ScrollableView.description:
A view that encapsulates a horizontally-scrolling set of child views, known as pages, navigable
using its built-in horizontal swipe gestures.

Ti.UI.SearchBar.description: A specialized text field for entering search text.

SearchBarToken.description: The search bar token for the Titanium.UI.SearchBar.insertTokenAtIndex method.

Size.description: A simple object consisting of size measurements.

Ti.UI.Slider.description: A slider component with a draggable thumb.

Ti.UI.Tab.description: A tab instance for a TabGroup.

TabIconInsets.description: Dictionary to specify edge insets for Titanium.UI.Tab.iconInsets. Difference from typical Padding is that right and bottom are ignored and calculated internally from top/left values.

Ti.UI.TabbedBar.description: A button bar that maintains a selected state.

Ti.UI.TableView.description:
A table view is used to present information, organized in sections and rows, in a
vertically-scrolling view.

TableViewAnimationProperties.description: A simple object for specifying the animation properties to use when inserting or deleting rows, or scrolling the table.

TableViewIndexEntry.description: A simple object that represents an index entry in a TableView.

Ti.UI.TableViewRow.description: A table view row is an individual item in a table, organized into table view sections.

Ti.UI.TableViewSection.description: A table view section is a container within a table used to organize table view rows.

Ti.UI.TextArea.description: A multiline text field that supports editing and scrolling.

textAreaSelectedParams.description: Dictionary object of parameters for the Titanium.UI.TextArea.selected event and Titanium.UI.TextArea.selection property that describes position and length of the selected text.

textFieldSelectedParams.description: Dictionary object of parameters for the Titanium.UI.TextField.selection property that describes position and length of the selected text.

TextFieldPadding.description: Dictionary object of parameters for the Titanium.UI.TextField.padding that describes the padding. Most notable difference from typical Padding is that top/bottom are only supported on Android.

Ti.UI.Toolbar.description: A Toolbar can contain buttons, as well as certain other widgets, including text fields and labels.

Point.description: A pair of coordinates used to describe the location of a Titanium.UI.View.

Gradient.description: A simple object defining a color gradient.

GradientColorRef.description: A simple object consisting of a color and an offset.

MinMaxOptions.description: An object for setting min/max value pairs.

ViewPositionOptions.description:
Pass an object with the following key-value pairs:
  • view (Titanium.UI.View): View to insert
  • position (Number): Position in the children array of the view elment to replace.

Ti.UI.WebView.description: The web view allows you to open an HTML5 based view which can load either local or remote content.

SnapshotResult.description: The parameter passed to the Titanium.UI.WebView.takeSnapshot callback.

DataCreationResult.description: The parameter passed to the Titanium.UI.WebView.createPDF or Titanium.UI.WebView.createWebArchivecallback.

StringSearchOptions.description: The optional options to pass to the Titanium.UI.WebView.findString. Pass a dictionary with one or more of the following string-keys: * caseSensitive (Boolean value) * backward (Boolean value) * wraps (Boolean value)

BackForwardList.description: The object returned to the Titanium.UI.WebView.backForwardList method.

BackForwardListItem.description: The object represents a webpage in the back-forward of a web view.

OnLinkURLResponse.description: An object returned when the Titanium.UI.WebView.onlink callback is fired.

UserScriptParams.description: Dictionary of options for the Titanium.UI.WebView.addUserScript method.

Ti.UI.Window.description: The Window is an empty drawing surface or container.

openWindowParams.description: Dictionary of options for the Titanium.UI.Window.open method.

windowToolbarParam.description: Dictionary of options for the Titanium.UI.Window.setToolbar method.

closeWindowParams.description: Dictionary of options for the Titanium.UI.Window.close method.

titleAttributesParams.description: Dictionary of options for the Titanium.UI.Window.titleAttributes property.

shadowDict.description: Dictionary describing the shadow effect for text.

Ti.UI.iOS.AlertDialogStyle.description: A set of constants for the style that can be used for the style property of Titanium.UI.AlertDialog.

Ti.UI.iOS.AnchorAttachmentBehavior.description: Dynamic behavior to support connections between an anchor point and an item.

Ti.UI.iOS.AnimationStyle.description:
A set of constants for the animation styles used for view transitions. One of the group of animation style constants
  • CURL_DOWN
  • CURL_UP
  • FLIP_FROM_LEFT
  • FLIP_FROM_RIGHT
  • FLIP_FROM_TOP
  • FLIP_FROM_BOTTOM
  • CROSS_DISSOLVE
  • NONE

Ti.UI.iOS.Animator.description: Provides support for the built-in iOS dynamic animations

Ti.UI.iOS.BlurView.description: A Titanium.UI.iOS.BlurView object gives you an easy way implement some complex visual effects. The blur effect is applied to every view the blur view is added to by default. You can also place the blur view above other views and all visible views layered under the blur view are blurred as well. For more information on BlurView, please refer to the official Apple documentation. Note: Apple introduced two new constants Titanium.UI.iOS.BLUR_EFFECT_STYLE_REGULAR and Titanium.UI.iOS.BLUR_EFFECT_STYLE_PROMINENT in iOS 10. These are internally mapped to Titanium.UI.iOS.BLUR_EFFECT_STYLE_LIGHT and Titanium.UI.iOS.BLUR_EFFECT_STYLE_EXTRA_LIGHT.

Ti.UI.iOS.CollisionBehavior.description: Dynamic behavior to support collisions between items and boundaries.

BoundaryIdentifier.description: Dictionary to specify a boundary identifier for Titanium.UI.iOS.CollisionBehavior.addBoundary.

Ti.UI.iOS.CoverFlowView.description:
The cover flow view is a container showing animated three-dimensional images in a style
consistent with the cover flow presentation style used for iPod, iTunes, and file browsing.

CoverFlowImageType.description: Simple object for defining a single image in a cover flow view.

Ti.UI.iOS.DocumentViewer.description:
A DocumentViewer provides in-app support for managing user interactions with files on the
local system.

DocumentViewerOptions.description: A simple object for specifying options when showing or dismissing a Titanium.UI.iOS.DocumentViewer.

Ti.UI.iOS.DynamicItemBehavior.description: Base dynamic configuration for an item.

Ti.UI.iOS.FeedbackGenerator.description:
The feedback generator API is introduced in iOS 10 to handle the haptic feedback when using an iPhone 7 or
later devices.

Ti.UI.iOS.GravityBehavior.description: Gravitational force to apply to an item.

Ti.UI.iOS.ListViewScrollPosition.description: A set of constants for the position value that can be used for the position property of ListViewAnimationProperties when invoking the ListView's scrollToItem, appendSection, deleteSectionAt, insertSectionAt and replaceSectionAt methods.

Ti.UI.iOS.ListViewStyle.description: A set of constants for the style that can be used for the style property of Titanium.UI.ListView.

Ti.UI.iOS.LivePhoto.description: Abstract object representing a live photo used in Titanium.UI.iOS.LivePhotoView.

Ti.UI.iOS.LivePhotoView.description: A view to display a Titanium.UI.iOS.LivePhoto object introduced in iOS 9.1.

Ti.UI.iOS.MenuPopup.description:
A menu popup provides the ability to create custom tooltip options using the items property covering the native UIMenuController class. See also:
  • iOS Developer Library: UIMenuController

MenuPopupShowParams.description: Dictionary of options for showing a menu popup with Titanium.UI.iOS.MenuPopup.show.

Ti.UI.iOS.PreviewAction.description:
A PreviewAction provides options to configure actions used by the iOS 9 3D-Touch "Peek and Pop"
feature.

Ti.UI.iOS.PreviewActionGroup.description:
A PreviewActionGroup provides options to configure a group of actions used by the iOS9 3D-Touch
feature "Peek and Pop".

Ti.UI.iOS.PreviewContext.description: A PreviewContext provides options to configure the iOS 9 3D-Touch "Peek and Pop" feature.

Ti.UI.iOS.ProgressBarStyle.description: A set of constants for the bar styles used on the style property of Titanium.UI.ProgressBar.

Ti.UI.iOS.PushBehavior.description: Continuous or instantaneous force to apply to an item.

Ti.UI.iOS.RowAnimationStyle.description: A set of constants for the Animation Styles used for transition on table view rows.

Ti.UI.iOS.ScrollIndicatorStyle.description: A set of constants for the styles available for scrollbars used with Titanium.UI.ScrollView.scrollIndicatorStyle and Titanium.UI.TableView.scrollIndicatorStyle properties.

Ti.UI.iOS.SnapBehavior.description: Dynamic behavior defining an item's movement to a specific point.

Ti.UI.iOS.SplitWindow.description:
A SplitWindow is a window that manages the presentation of two side-by-side view
controllers.

Ti.UI.iOS.StatusBar.description: A set of constants for the status bar style.

Ti.UI.iOS.Stepper.description: A widget used to increment and decrement a value.

Ti.UI.iOS.SystemButton.description: A set of constants for creating standard iOS system buttons.

Ti.UI.iOS.SystemIcon.description: A set of constants for the system icon styles that can be used on a tab group tab.

BarItemType.description: Object describing a button bar or tabbed bar item.

Ti.UI.iOS.TableViewScrollPosition.description: A set of constants for the position value that can be used for the position property of Titanium.UI.TableView when invoking scrollToIndex.

Ti.UI.iOS.TableViewStyle.description: A set of constants for the style that can be used for the style property of Titanium.UI.TableView and Titanium.UI.ListView.

Ti.UI.iOS.TransitionAnimation.description: A transition animation when opening or closing windows in a Titanium.UI.NavigationWindow or Titanium.UI.Tab. Use this proxy with the Window's transitionAnimation property.

Ti.UI.iOS.ViewAttachmentBehavior.description: Dynamic behavior to support connections between two items.

Ti.UI.iOS.WebViewConfiguration.description: A collection of properties used to initialize a web view.

WebViewPreferencesObject.description: The parameter passed to the Titanium.UI.iOS.WebViewConfiguration.preferences method.

Ti.UI.iOS.WebViewDecisionHandler.description: It represents the decision handler to tell to webview, whether allow or cancel the navigation.

Ti.UI.iOS.WebViewProcessPool.description: It represents a pool of Web Content processes.

Ti.UI.iOS.description:
Apple iOS specific UI capabilities.  All properties, methods and events in this namespace will
only work on Apple iOS devices.

SystemImageParameters.description: Dictionary object of parameters for the 2nd parameter of the <Titanium.UI.iOS.systemButton> method to pass additional configuration options like weight and size. Available in Titanium SDK 10.1.0 and later.

Ti.UI.iPad.Popover.description: A Popover is used to manage the presentation of content in a popover.

Ti.Utils.description:
The top-level Utils module, containing a set of JavaScript methods that are often useful when
building applications.

Ti.WatchSession.description: Used to enable data and file transfers between a watchOS and iOS application.

MessageReply.description: Reply message received from watch app.

Ti.XML.Attr.description: Represents an attribute of an Element.

Ti.XML.CDATASection.description:
Used to include blocks of literal text containing characters that would otherwise need
to be escaped.

Ti.XML.CharacterData.description: An interface extending Titanium.XML.Node with a set of attributes and methods for accessing character data in the DOM. Implements the DOM Level 2 API on Android and iOS. For reasons of compatibility with the javascript engine, text is represented by UTF-8 instead of UTF-16 on Android and iOS.

Ti.XML.Comment.description: Represents the contents of an XML comment.

Ti.XML.DOMImplementation.description: The Titanium.XML.DOMImplementation interface provides a number of methods for performing operations that are independent of any particular instance of the document object model.Implements the DOM Level 2 API on Android and iOS.

Ti.XML.DocumentFragment.description: A lightweight document object used as a container for a group of nodes.

Ti.XML.DocumentType.description: Each Titanium.XML.Document has a doctype attribute whose value is either 'null' or a Titanium.XML.DocumentType object.

Ti.XML.Element.description: Represents an element in a DOM document, a Titanium.XML.Node defined by a start-tag and end-tag (or an empty tag). Elements may have attributes associated with them. Implements the DOM Level 2 API on Android and iOS with some non-standard extensions.

Ti.XML.Entity.description: This interface represents an entity, either parsed or unparsed, in an XML document. Note that this models the entity itself not the entity declaration. The nodeName attribute that is inherited from Node contains the name of the entity. An Entity node does not have any parent. Implements the DOM Level 2 API on Android and iOS.

Ti.XML.NamedNodeMap.description: A key-value paired map that maps String objects to Titanium.XML.Node objects. Implements the DOM Level 2 API on Android and iOS.

Ti.XML.Node.description: A single node in the Document tree.

Ti.XML.NodeList.description: A list of Titanium.XML.Node objects. Implements the DOM Level 2 API on Android and iOS.

Ti.XML.Notation.description: Represents a notation declared in the DTD. Implements the DOM Level 2 API on Android and iOS.

Ti.XML.ProcessingInstruction.description: A way to keep processor-specific information in the text of the document. Implements the DOM Level 2 API on Android and iOS.

Ti.XML.Text.description: Represents the textual content of an Titanium.XML.Element or Titanium.XML.Attr Implements the DOM Level 2 API on Android and iOS.

Ti.XML.description: The top level XML module.  The XML module is used for parsing and processing XML-based content.

YQLResponse.description: Properties passed to a yql callback to report a success or failure.
